captions.text:
"Hey boy you wanna go cow tippin!"
"No sir that is physically impossible

and your breath smells bad"
"whaaaaat?!?!?"
So! It turns out cow tipping is FAKE!
Yeah sure maybe a few cows have been tipped over time but our friends over

at Modern Farmer took a look at
the cold hard facts and found 2 solid
arguments.

Number One! There's no actual video proof
on the Internet!

These days on the Internet you can look up 
anything from aliens

to cute cuddly kitty cats even a young man
freaking out to roller skating babies in his
whitie tighties

Through out the cornucopia
of clips I've yet to find one LEGIT COW
TIP.... SO ARE COW TIPS LEGIT? NO!

So before you try and go out and tip a cow
to prove me wrong, beware its physically impossible!

The guys over at modern farmer interviewed
a man named Nate Wilson who grew up around

cows his whole life and even now at the age
of 66 still thinks its BS. He says cows don't

even sleep standing up and they're 
pretty much scared shitless! That's why

when cows hang out together they're always
facing opposite directions so they can always
keep a look out for danger!
Hey Mark how's it goin over there? Pretty good Ned, how ya been? I'm pretty good. I miss your face! I miss your face too man!

The University of British Columbia did a study
in 2005 basically stating that there's no way that one

drunk bro could tip over a cow. Now maaaaybe 2
drunk bros after winning a game of
beer pong but still it's not gonna be easy.

LETS GET PHYSICAL! R=You guys remember newton's second
law?? Force equals mass times acceleration.

Which means your gonna need a LOT of force
to move ALL THAT MASS I mean come on people

that's like a 1000 hamburgers..... actually
one cow can make up to 1500 -- 2500 hamburgers
BUT that's besides the point. "I'm sorry vegetarians...I love you"

Now if a single 145 pound person can generate up to
660 newtons of force then maybe 2 people have

enough power but as soon as that cow braces its
self, and believe me it will, those 2 dudes
are gonna need a whole lot more back up.

Okay so lets be real here folks cow tipping has
been around for a long time, we've heard

it being talked about in movies and cartoons
heck even my friends would tell me about it

when I was a kid. BUT my friends also
told me that if I turned off the lights and

said bloody Mary 3 times into the mirror that I would
get murdered. Either way the legend of cow
tipping lives on.
So know you know cow tipping is pretty much BS, go out and tell the world! Cause you know what's happening folks?
Drunk dudes are going out there into the farms and they're like oh dude let's hit that cow!
And they're running into the cows with their shoulders and it's hurting the cows!
This has been a public service announcement from Alex Farnham and Animalist News. I'll see you harry mammals tomorrow. Save the cows!

comments.author: ChristopherandHobbes

comments.text:
f=ma is not relevant here: f=ma describes the behaviour of an object when a 
force is applied through its centre of mass. Two drunk guys aren't gonna 
know where the cow's centre of mass is.

Furthermore, they aren't trying to accelerate the cow- that would involve 
moving the whole cow. As was pointed out, this would be very hard. Instead, 
they are trying to tip the cow, which only requires them to move the cow 
such that it will be in unstable equilibrium- that is to say, it will 
topple. Therefore, we apply the physics of moments m(p)=fd (the moment 
about a point is equal to the force applied about said point multiplied by 
the distance between the perpendicular of the acting force and the 
pivot) Cows are very top-heavy (big bodies, [relatively] thin legs) meaning 
they have a high centre of mass, and have very long legs (meaning a larger 
moment). This makes tipping a cow over relatively easy.﻿

"You have to push a super heavy cow! No mere mortal can do that"
Actually you just have to knock it off balance and let it fall, it wont be 
bracing itself because it's sleeping, and have you seen their skinny little 
legs? It's surprising they stand upright at all.
"Cows don't sleep standing up"
Maybe some cows don't and maybe it's because they're on to our cow tipping 
ways, but I've personally seen a whole herd standing in a field sleeping.
"Actually it's physically impossible"
You've never tried and you've never seen it tired, I've seen it done. It's 
possible.

Now that's true, don't tip cows people not because it's impossible, but 
because you'd have to be a jerk to do it.﻿

only drunk inbred rednecks would find this offensive, you finding this 
offensive only serves to point out what you are. allso, for one person to 
tip a cow is in fact, physicaly impossible, not enoth mass unless you are a 
heavyweight sumowrestler, and if you are, then you are gonna have a hard

catch it offguard and thats not possible since it will hear and smell you 
comming longe before you can even touch it with a 10 meter long pole, and 
when/if you do get up to it and start pushing it, you realy think its just 
gonna stay there and let you push it?

comments.text:
Our shops sell "cow tipping" shirts.  I laugh as people either claim to do 
it or start complaining it is mean.  I then ask when was the last time they 
saw cow tipping on youtube, AFHM or any other type video show/format.   
They are typically blank. 

Funny thing is many Australians take the cow "tipping" thing as a sexual 
joke.  I have been told this by many Australians who get a kick out of the 
shirt and the fact we sell it.  They are often disappointed when I inform 
them it means pushing them over, not giving them "the tip"﻿
